description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3gsrn","text":"Here we describe a protocol for SMRT-Tag: Single-Molecule Real-Time sequencing by Tagmentation - a transposase-mediated strategy for producing low-input, multiplexable, PCR-free PacBio sequencing libraries. SMRT-Tag requires only 1-5% as much input material as existing protocols (15,000–50,000 human cell equivalents) and enables highly-sensitive and simultaneous detection of single nucleotide variants, small insertions / deletions, and CpG methylation comparable to the current state-of-the-art.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":42,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":49,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":58,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":63,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":82,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1lfss","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4nced","text":"In brief, high-quality genomic DNA are tagmented using hairpin-loaded Tn5-adaptors, gap-repaired, exo-digested, and then sequenced on the PacBio Sequel II platform. All steps from purified gDNA to sequencing-ready libraries can be performed in one day. We have demonstrated the utility of SMRT-Tag on input as low as 80ng in HG002 - HG004. {"blocks":[{"key":"7tt3q","text":"Once homogenized, measure the concentration and purity of HMW gDNA on a microvolume spectrophotometer (e.g. Nanodrop). Qubit-based concentration values are \u003e25% consistently lower than OD-based estimates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4uh5s","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bm0es","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"clsed","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":130,"offset":43}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b64ti","text":"For QC measures of HMW DNA, see reference: https://www.neb.com/tools-and-resources/usage-guidelines/measuring-analyzing-and-storing-high-molecular-weight-dna-hmw-dna-samples","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"F854AB900D1B11EDB1E19535C934E40D","url":"https://www.neb.com/tools-and-resources/usage-guidelines/measuring-analyzing-and-storing-high-molecular-weight-dna-hmw-dna-samples"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"link"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8n5pa","text":"Dilute QC-approved HMW gDNA to 50-100 ng/µL with 1x EB (or 10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.5) and measure the diluted concentration with Qubit 1x High Sensitivity DNA Assay.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mmu7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2mqs","text":"[CRITICAL] Do not dilute gDNA in TE buffer since EDTA will decrease the Tn5 efficiency in downstream tagmentation reactions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f7pee","text":"Reconstitute HPLC-purified SMRT-Tag adaptors (IDT) to 100 µM in RNAse-free water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Assembling SMRT-Tn5 transposomes (Tn5 loaded with SMRT-Tag adaptors)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8t1tk","text":"Thaw Tn5 enzyme stock (3.9mg/mL) on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6oc1d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fcnna","text":"Incubate the gap-repair reactions at 37ºC for 1 hr and hold at 4ºC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6otmm","text":"Incubate the tagmentation reactions at 55ºC for 30 min and hold at 4ºC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3s2te","text":"Add 2.5 µL of 0.2% SDS per sample. Pipette slowly to mix and sit at room temperature for 5 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6nadf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fnqqj","text":"[NOTE] Placing the tubes on ice after 5 min can help reduce bubble formation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aieai","text":"Dilute each sample (12.5 µL) to 30 µL with 1x EB and add 2x volume of resuspended, room-temperature SPRI beads to clean up the reactions. Mix well using a P200 with wide-bore tips.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ev1ts","text":"[OPTIONAL] QC check - take 1µL aliquot and determine the gap-repaired concentration using Qubit 1x High Sensitivity DNA Assay. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fcnna","text":"Incubate the exo-digest reactions at 37ºC for 1 hr, then hold at 4ºC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2an47","text":"Pool all libraries after exo-digest and dilute up to 50 µL with 1x EB if the pooled volume is \u003c50 µL. Add 3.1x volume of resuspended, room-temperature 35% AMPure PB beads using a wide-bore pipette and mix gently at least 10 times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8iv1q","text":"Determine the concentration of pooled, enriched HMW library using Qubit 1x High Sensitivity DNA Assay. {"blocks":[{"key":"bit68","text":"Sequence the multiplexed, pooled library on PacBio Sequel II 8M SMRTcells with either Sequel II Binding Kit 2.1 (e.g. up to 220pM loading concentration with 30h movie time, 2h pre-extension, and 4h immobilization), or Sequel II Binding Kit 2.2 (e.g. up to 120pM loading concentration with 30h movie time, 2h pre-extension, and 4h adaptive loading). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"45hpo","text":"Dilute adaptors to 20 µM in annealing buffer (10mM Tris-HCl pH 7.5 and 100mM NaCl) in PCR tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"brcov","text":"Place the tubes in a thermocycler at 95°C with a heated lid at 105ºC for 5 min, then remove them from the heat source and slowly cool to room temperature for at least 30 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5g6tq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55bku","text":"[NOTE] Annealed adaptors can be stored at -20°C for up to 6 months.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Assembling SMRT-Tn5 transposomes (Tn5 loaded with SMRT-Tag adaptors)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"audkm","text":"Dilute to 1mg/mL (or 18.9 µM monomer) in Tn5 dilution buffer (50mM Tris pH 7.5, 0.065mM EDTA, 2mM DTT, 60% glycerol) and slowly mix 10-15 times with a wide-bore pipette. The mixture is extremely viscous. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7t58t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Assembling SMRT-Tn5 transposomes (Tn5 loaded with SMRT-Tag adaptors)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eikas","text":"Let sit on a rotational mixer at 4ºC for at least 3 hr until the mixture becomes fully homogenized.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Assembling SMRT-Tn5 transposomes (Tn5 loaded with SMRT-Tag adaptors)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"29mpa","text":"Mix 1.02x volume of 1mg/mL Tn5 with 1x volume of 20 µM annealed SMRT-Tag adaptors using a wide-bore pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2b2js","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Assembling SMRT-Tn5 transposomes (Tn5 loaded with SMRT-Tag adaptors)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eou8t","text":"Incubate the mixture at 23ºC for 55 min with continuous shaking at 350 rpm. After 55 min, place on ice. Loaded SMRT-Tn5 transposome (~9.4µM monomer) can be supplemented with glycerol up to a final concentration of 50% and stored at −20° for up to 6 months. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"avj2i","text":"Incubate the bead-mixed samples in a thermomixer at 23ºC for 30 min with interval mixing @ 350 rpm (1 min on, 3 min off) to keep the beads resuspended.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e8bv9","text":"Spin down quickly. Place on magnet and allow to clear before carefully withdrawing supernatant. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dormv","text":"Wash beads twice with 80% ethanol for 30 sec. Add ethanol to the wall opposite of beads. Withdraw supernatant and after a quick spin, remove the remaining liquid with a P20 pipette. Beads take ~30 s to 1 min to dry. Do not over-dry the beads - dried beads appear to be fragmented with cracks in light brown. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7nus2","text":"Remove from the magnet stand, and gently resuspend the bead pellet in 12 µL 1x EB (or 10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.5) to elute the extracted DNA. Once beads are resuspended, mix well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9qfg2","text":"Incubate the samples in a thermomixer at 37ºC for 15 min with interval mixing @350 rpm (1 min on, 3 min off) to promote increased DNA elution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9kd0t","text":"Spin samples down quickly. Place on magnet and allow to clear before carefully transferring the supernatant to a new LoBind tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9foi6","text":"Load each SMRT-Tn5 transposome per well on a NativePAGE 4-16% Bis-Tris Gel along with GeneRuler Ultra Low Range DNA Ladder, a negative DNA control (Tn5 without SMRT-Tag adaptors), a negative protein control (annealed SMRT-Tag oligos without Tn5), a positive control (Tn5 loaded with any confirmed adaptors i.e Nextera N5/N7 oligos) if available.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"74k7v","text":"Add 200mL of cold cathode buffer (1x NativePAGE running buffer and 0.1x NativePAGE cathode additive) to the inner chamber. Add 600mL of cold anode buffer (1x NativePAGE running buffer) to the outer chamber.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e51hb","text":"Run the gel at 150V for 1 hr at 4ºC, followed by 180V for 15 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f8ni0","text":"Stain the gel with 1x SYBR Gold Solution for ~30 min on a shaker. Visualize on a LiCor or any imaging system to confirm the proper loading of SMRT-Tn5 transposomes. {"blocks":[{"key":"fun7u","text":"Stain the gel with 1x Coomassie Blue for 1 hr at RT on a shaker, destain for at least 20 min with millipore dH2O, and image using ambient light to confirm the presence of protein band.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fqrnk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5ias","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fm530","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d2n9l","text":"Reference fig. 2: loaded SMRT-Tn5 on a NativePAGE after Coomassie stain.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"nqam","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"34n24","text":"  ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"4q5en","text":"[NOTE] Not all samples loaded on the reference gel are required. All six loaded Tn5 transposomes can be visualized. The negative protein controls (annealed SMRT-Tag oligos without Tn5) are NOT visualized by the Coomassie stain. {"blocks":[{"key":"ch5ij","text":"For each tagmentation reaction, add 2 µL of 5x TAPS buffer, 1 µL of DMF,  160ng of gDNA as template, 1 µL of serially diluted SMRT-Tn5 transposome (i.e 1x, 4x, 16x, 64x), and dilute up to 10 µL with dH2O. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"clhfd","text":"Terminate the reactions by adding 2.5 µL of 0.2% SDS and incubate for 5 min at RT. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"s9ti","text":"Mix each reaction (12.5 µL) with 2.5 µL of 6x loading dye and load on a 0.5% agarose gel coupled with the NEB 1kb-Extend ladder. Run at 60-80V for 2-3 hr. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4etbe","text":"Stain the gel with 1x SYBR Gold Solution in TAE buffer for ~30 min on a shaker.
